dt: {bc}a purine base C{inf}5{/inf}H{inf}5{/inf}N{inf}5{/inf} that codes hereditary information in the genetic code in DNA and RNA {dx}compare {dxt|cytosine||}, {dxt|guanine||}, {dxt|thymine||}, {dxt|uracil||}{/dx}

et: borrowed from German {it}Adenin,{/it} from Greek {it}aden-, adḗn{/it} "gland" + German {it}-in{/it} {et_link|-ine:2|-ine:2}; so called from its presence in glandular tissue {ma}{mat|adeno-|}{/ma}
shortdef: a purine base C5H5N5 that codes hereditary information in the genetic code in DNA and RNA
a coenzyme C27H33N9O15P2 of some flavoproteins

dt: {bc}a coenzyme C{inf}21{/inf}H{inf}27{/inf}N{inf}7{/inf}O{inf}14{/inf}P{inf}2{/inf} of numerous dehydrogenases that occurs in most cells and plays an important role in all phases of intermediary metabolism as an oxidizing agent or when in the reduced form as a reducing agent for various metabolites

shortdef: a coenzyme C21H27N7O14P2 of numerous dehydrogenases that occurs in most cells and plays an important role in all phases of intermediary metabolism as an oxidizing agent or when in the reduced form as a reducing agent for various metabolites —called also nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide, diphosphopyridine nucleotide, DPN

dt: {bc}a coenzyme C{inf}21{/inf}H{inf}28{/inf}N{inf}7{/inf}O{inf}17{/inf}P{inf}3{/inf} of numerous dehydrogenases (such as that acting on glucose-6-phosphate) that occurs especially in red blood cells and plays a role in intermediary metabolism similar to NAD but acting often on different metabolites

shortdef: a coenzyme C21H28N7O17P3 of numerous dehydrogenases (such as that acting on glucose-6-phosphate) that occurs especially in red blood cells and plays a role in intermediary metabolism similar to NAD but acting often on different metabolites —called also nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate, TPN, triphosphopyridine nucleotide
